project.teaser: Sustainability and the transition to a low-carbon, more resource-efficient and circular economy are key in ensuring the long-term competitiveness of the European Union (EU) economy. Sustainability has long been at the heart of the European Union project and the EU Treaties...
project.objective: Sustainability and the transition to a low-carbon, more resource-efficient and circular economy are key in ensuring the long-term competitiveness of the European Union (EU) economy. Sustainability has long been at the heart of the European Union project and the EU Treaties give recognition to its social and environmental dimensions. Advanced industrial technologies are at the heart of the Industrial Revolution, shaping the future of production and value chains. It opens opportunities for companies to shape a new wave of economic growth. More than 75 percent of European Industrial SMEs indicate that the main barrier for the implementation of Advanced Technologies is the lack of financial resources and access to considerable investment opportunities. The STAGE project will create the sustainability transition ecosystem, train Sustainability Advisors and provide high-quality innovation and sustainability assessment, decentralised training courses and innovation support and sustainability transition services to more than 2000 European industrial SMEs during the project duration, transforming them into the agile and green enterprises, competitive and sustainable leaders of the European industrial economy. STAGE will achieve the Grant Amount Multiplier of 100x with Private Finance during the project.
project.title: Sustainable Transition to the Agile and Green Enterprise
project.keywords: Sustainable Transition, Sustainability Advisors, Decentralised Training Courses, Training the Trainers, Access to Finance, Private Investing

result.description: periodic

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Using Digital Twin Technology to Improve the Organization of the Supply Chain in Piece Type of Production

details.authors: Matevž Resman, Mihael Debevec, Niko Herakovič

result.title: A comparative study of machine learning regression models for production systems condition monitoring

details.authors: D. Jankovic, M. Simic, N. Herakovic
details.publisher: Production Engineering Institute (PEI), Faculty of Mechanical Engineering

result.title: D2.2.1 Sustainability Advisors Training Verification
result.description: This deliverable will include the initial data and results of the sustainability advisors training and verification.

result.title: D1.2.2 STAGE Ecosystem Map
result.description: This deliverable is an output of the analysis of ST 1.2.1 and will include industry best practices, networks and gaps in the market.

result.title: D3.2.1 Incentives Plan Administrative Documentation Set
result.description: This deliverable includes the collection of Incentives Plan Administrative Documentation.

result.title: Polynomial Regression-Based Predictive Expert System for Enhancing Hydraulic Press Performance over a 5G Network

details.authors: Denis Jankovič, Miha Pipan, Marko Šimic, Niko Herakovič

result.title: D4.3.2 Impact Assessment Report - first version
result.description: This deliverable will include the results of the monitoring activities and registered impacts.

result.title: D1.2.3 Sustainability Transition Methodology
result.description: This deliverable is an output of the analysis of ST 1.2.2 and will include the development of high-quality Innovation and Sustainability Training Framework(s) Methodology based on outputs and EU methodologies.

result.title: D4.1 Communication and Dissemination Plan
result.description: This deliverable will be the output of Task 4.1 and will include the detailed planning of all communication activities of the STAGE campaign in a systematic manner.

result.title: D3.2.2 Incentives Plan Call Documentation Set
result.description: This deliverable includes the collection of Incentives Plan Call Documentation, eg guidelines and templates, feedback template, processes and tools etc.

result.title: Integrating Digital Twin Technology to Achieve Higher Operational Efficiency and Sustainability in Manufacturing Systems

details.authors: Matevž Resman, Niko Herakovič, Mihael Debevec

result.title: D3.3.2 Recruitment Assessment Documentation
result.description: This deliverable includes the assessment documentation for the recruitment calls of Industrial SMEs.

result.title: D3.1 Operational Model for Sustainability Centres
result.description: This deliverable includes the output of Subtask 3.1.3 Strategy and action plan for building and running the STAGE Ecosystem.

result.title: D2.1.1 Sustainability Transition Intro Course
result.description: This deliverable includes an intro course free of charge which will be an important asset to liaise with industrial SMEs since the very beginning of the project.

result.title: D4.3.1 Impact Assessment Plan
result.description: This deliverable will include a monitoring and impact assessment plan.

result.title: D5.2 Data Management Plan - first version
result.description: This deliverable will be the output of Task 5.1 and will be formulated (in line with the EC Guidelines on FAIR Data Management) from the early stages of the project (M3 to be updated on M18 and M36), describing the data management life cycle of the data to be collected, processed and/or generated by the project and laying out the approach for their sound and FAIR management. It will evolve during the lifespan of the project as a living document and provide details on the data (schemas, datasets, etc.) as well as their management (what type of data, how the data will be collected, shared, handled and preserved according to GDPR), ensuring that all aspects of data handling, treatment, reporting and access are clear to partners.

result.title: D4.2 Communication and Dissemination Activity Report - first version
result.description: This deliverable will include the report on the Communication and Dissemination tools and activities, as described in Task 4.2.

result.title: D1.2.1 Business Needs Assessment Report
result.description: This deliverable will enable to better select initiatives and use case analysis from T2.2 that will be used as input for the training framework development and its training modules in T2.1.

result.title: D1.4 STAGE Platform Specification and Verification - final version
result.description: This deliverable is an output of T1.4 and will include STAGE Platform specification and verification.

result.title: D3.3.1 Online Form for Industrial SMEs
result.description: This deliverable includes the online form for the recruitment calls of Industrial SMEs.

result.title: D2.1.2 Decentralised Sustainability Open Courses
result.description: This deliverable includes Decentralised Sustainability Open Courses to transform SMEs into Agile and Green Enterprises.

result.title: D5.2 Data Management Plan - updated version
result.description: This deliverable will be the output of Task 5.1 and will be formulated (in line with the EC Guidelines on FAIR Data Management) from the early stages of the project (M3 to be updated on M18 and M36), describing the data management life cycle of the data to be collected, processed and/or generated by the project and laying out the approach for their sound and FAIR management. It will evolve during the lifespan of the project as a living document and provide details on the data (schemas, datasets, etc.) as well as their management (what type of data, how the data will be collected, shared, handled and preserved according to GDPR), ensuring that all aspects of data handling, treatment, reporting and access are clear to partners.

result.title: D1.4 STAGE Platform Specification and Verification - first version
result.description: This deliverable is an output of T1.4 and will include STAGE Platform specification and verification.

result.title: D1.3 STAGE Training Kit Specification
result.description: This deliverable is an output of T1.3 and will include the creation and aggregation of a set of contents and materials which will be used within SME Assessment (T1.1) and Sustainability Support (T2.2) including MOOCs, Webinar platforms, Sustainability Scan, SME Digital readiness assessment, Circular economy maturity assessment (CEMA), RoadMAPP, Virtual Reality (VR) and other digital tools.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
